title: Ticket #1979: Installer throws a warning if the firewall service is deactivated.
description:
The Windows firewall service can be turned off and any attempt by installers to punch holes in it will result in a warning message box popping up. This is only a problem if the service itself is turned off explicitly. Turning off the firewall through the control panel does not turn off the service. This could potentially be a problem during unattended installs and is also likely to confuse end users. Ignoring the error will allow the installation to complete successfully but the best solution is to find a way to conditionalize the firewall hole punching.

  • Determine if there is a way to detect what services are running on a system.
  • See if the firewall exception schema can be conditionalized.
  • Depending on results of previous two efforts, determine best course of action for dealing with unattended installs.
